item.title: Aimee add a quote by Christopher Moore
Aimee add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Aimee add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "You can lead a horticulture, but you can't make her think." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Aimee add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Aimee add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Don't be ridiculous, Charlie, people love the parents who beat their kids in department stores. It's the ones who just let their kids wreak havoc that everybody hates." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Aimee add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "The only difference between a suicide and a martyrdom really is the amount of press coverage." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Aimee add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up. You build up all these defenses, you build up a whole suit of armor, so that nothing can hurt you, then one stupid person, no different from any other stupid person, wanders into your stupid life...You give them a piece of you. They didn't ask for it. They did something dumb one day, like kiss you or smile at you, and then your life isn't your own anymore. Love takes hostages. It gets inside you. It eats you out and leaves you crying in the darkness, so simple a phrase like 'maybe we should be just friends' turns into a glass splinter working its way into your heart. It hurts. Not just in the imagination. Not just in the mind. It's a soul-hurt, a real gets-inside-you-and-rips-you-apart pain. I hate love." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Aimee add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "You — you strange — you almost unearthly thing! — I love as my own flesh. You — poor and obscure, and small and plain as you are — I entreat to accept me as a husband." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Aimee add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "It's so hard to forget pain, but it's even harder to remember sweetness. We have no scar to show for happiness. We learn so little from peace." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Aimee add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Words are easy, like the wind; Faithful friends are hard to find." -- William Shakespeare
